snippet: The stations, in New York City, on Long Island and in Westchester County, raised their prices after Hurricane Sandy, charging $4.74 to $5.50 a gallon, the New York attorney general said.
abstract: The stations, in New York City, on Long Island and in Westchester County, raised their prices after Hurricane Sandy, charging $4.74 to $5.50 a gallon, the New York attorney general said.

headline.main: State Accuses 13 New York Gas Stations of Price-Gouging
